suppress.notes: This suppresses CVEs from the version of bouncycastle brought in by jruby. We ship a more up-to-date version of bouncycastle that overrides this one, so it is safe to ignore these vulnerabilities.
This suppresses false positives for jruby. CVE-2010-1330 was resolved in JRuby 1.4.1. CVE-2011-4838 was resolved in JRuby 1.6.5.1.

This suppresses a medium vulnerability that was found in a cache crate for Rust. It is a false positive on the Java package core.cache-0.7.1 since the Java package that we use does not have any relation to Rust. The file name that causes the false positive: core.cache-0.7.1.jar
